snippet: Officials said the officer, who was off duty, was at a stoplight in Westchester late Tuesday when he fired at a car next to his, critically injuring a man in the passenger seat.
abstract: New York City Police Officer Brendan Cronin is arrested for what officials call 'completely random' shooting; Cronin, who was off duty and may have been drinking, was stopped at traffic light in Westchester County, NY, when he fired gun at car next to his, critically injuring man in passenger seat.

byline.original: By DANIEL KRIEGER and MICHAEL SCHWIRTZ
byline.contributor: Daniel Krieger reported from Pelham, and Michael Schwirtz from New York. Joseph Goldstein and J. David Goodman contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: Officials said the officer, who was off duty, was at a stoplight in Westchester late Tuesday when he fired at a car next to his, critically injuring a man in the passenger seat.

headline.main: New York City Police Officer Is Arrested in Westchester Shooting
headline.print_headline: City Police Officer Is Arrested in Westchester Shooting
